ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Got to work with a real world client so developed professional skills; learned more about the disability space and disability iLife representationwhich I knew nothing about until taking this course; improved my ability to work with a team
Learned all about disability inclusion from a variety of academic/corporate perspectives
I learned a lot about the issues of disability representation in the private and public sector- something I never had the chance to study before.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: Prof Davis!!!! Shes the best and made the course enjoyable and engaging (and our project was amazing)

Weaknesses: none
This class was amazing- truly no weaknesses
Doctor. Davis is just great. So in tune with the students, it really comes through that her wish is for the students to craft their own capstone, and her guidance throughout is so supportive.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! If you have the opportunity to have Professor Davis as your capstone advisor, you should jump at the chance!
Yes, this is an awesome capstone for global, very different from the other policy and security focused ones.
